content.p: Assistant Professor, CH Lim received his BSc (Hons.) and MSc degrees in Applied physics from University of Malaya (UM). He is currently an assistant professor in the University of Nottingham Malaysia. CH Lim was a collaborative researcher of the High Energy Density Physics Group at the University of Malaya and has extensive research experience in the areas of laser physics, plasma physics and pulsed power technology. He was involved in the design and development of the high voltage switching system in plasma physics research. His current research work focuses on pulsed plasma thruster for cubesats and low energy density plasma. Laser physics (N2 laser, CO2 laser, dye laser), pulsed power technology, Marx generator, plasma physics, cubesats thruster. CH Lim is currently a research leader of the project of pulsed plasma thruster for cubesats which collaborates with the researchers from University of Malaya.
